snippet: Egypt’s interim government said a state of emergency, as well as a nighttime curfew, would remain in place until it had received formal notice of a judicial ruling Tuesday.
abstract: Egypt's interim government says that it will abide by a judicial ruling ending a three-month state of emergency, which was imposed after authorities stormed two Islamist sit-ins in August; government says that, however, state of emergency will remain in place until it receives formal notice of the decision.
lead_paragraph: Egypt’s interim government said a state of emergency, as well as a nighttime curfew, would remain in place until it had received formal notice of a judicial ruling Tuesday.

headline.main: Egypt: Government Delays Ending State of Emergency and Curfew
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Government Delays Ending State of Emergency and Curfew
